name: Barking on the Bridge
description: The bond between humanoids and animals is a treasured one. But what happens when humanoid caretakers are forced to hear their pets' every want and desire? Restore things to the way they were before the Federation faces a cat-astrophe!
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Klingon, Hirogen, La'an, Archer or Keyla will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Klingon, Hirogen, La'an, Archer or Keyla
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Sela
featured_crew.flavor: This shadowy figure is the daughter of an alternate timeline Tasha Yar and is sent to drive a wedge between the UFP and the Klingons.

action.name: With Our Cloaking Devices, We Can Slip By You At Will

featured_crew.name: Keyla
featured_crew.flavor: Keyla was a Tandaran disguised as a different species with unclear motives who tried to get close to Archer and question him about the Cabal.

featured_crew.name: Worf
featured_crew.flavor: Called to defend the Empire in the civil war, Worf set aside his Starfleet commission to fight for Gowron.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: Worf
rewards.flavor: Called to defend the Empire in the civil war, Worf set aside his Starfleet commission to fight for Gowron.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

adventures.name: Roll Over
adventures.description: Give the humanoids and pets a biological scan.

adventures.name: Seek
adventures.description: Review Starfleet logs for any potential clues.

adventures.name: Off

adventures.description: Restore humanoid-animal communication to the way it was.

rewards.name: Barking on the Bridge
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Worf
rewards.flavor: Called to defend the Empire in the civil war, Worf set aside his Starfleet commission to fight for Gowron.

rewards.name: Keyla
rewards.flavor: Keyla was a Tandaran disguised as a different species with unclear motives who tried to get close to Archer and question him about the Cabal.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Captain, thank you for answering our hails. Things are getting a little hairy on our end. As strange as it sounds, I can somehow hear Porthos' thoughts. And apparently, it isn't just he and I. Pets and their caretakers across the galaxy are experiencing the same thing."

"You say this as if it is a bad thing. Why, I simply love the increased connection with my Runa. And now that I know her exact preferences, I can better instruct my servants to grant her every desire."

"Maybe for a princess with an army of servants, it's no trouble. But it isn't like Rhylo's thoughts are making much sense, like a conversation. It's more like being assaulted by all his emotions and desires. It makes concentrating on what I need to do difficult."

"I'm right there with you, Keyla. The amount of times cheese pops into my head is maddening. I've been holding strong, because he really shouldn't have much of it, but I'm only human. Here's hoping you can help us out, Captain."

"Captain, thank you for answering our hails. Things are getting a little hairy on our end. As strange as it sounds, I can somehow hear Porthos' thoughts. And apparently, it isn't just he and I. Pets and their caretakers across the galaxy are experiencing the same thing."

"You say this as if it is a bad thing. Why, I simply love the increased connection with my Runa. And now that I know her exact preferences, I can better instruct my servants to grant her every desire."

"Maybe for a princess with an army of servants, it's no trouble. But it isn't like Rhylo's thoughts are making much sense, like a conversation. It's more like being assaulted by all his emotions and desires. It makes concentrating on what I need to do difficult."

"I'm right there with you, Keyla. The amount of times cheese pops into my head is maddening. I've been holding strong, because he really shouldn't have much of it, but I'm only human. Here's hoping you can help us out, Captain."
"What is this voice? This is not my Runa's. It's higher pitched and..."

"Can you hear me? This human appears to have a strong connection with their companion, one that has allowed me to reach you. It is I who has lifted the veil and allowed you to communicate with one another."

responses.text: "Restore everything back to the way it was!"

screens.text: "For eons, my companion star and I have shared mass and, together, illuminated our system. Though it is far greater in size than I, it has nonetheless ensured I remain at least a standard size. To it, I suppose you humanoids would say, I am a pet."

"Yes. One of a pair. I believe you would call us binary stars. Over eons, however, we gained sentience. Through practice and amplifying off of other masses, I have gained the ability to reach out far beyond our own system."

"My companion and I have a symbiotic relationship. Yet I notice you humanoids do not share a similar relationship with your companions. Their frustrations go unheard. I wanted to give them a way to communicate with you."

"I am afraid I cannot do that. The creatures in your care deserve to be understood so that their needs are properly met. We have a symbiotic relationship and believe that is possible for you all as well."

"As much as I appreciate the connection with Porthos, it's difficult to focus on the bridge with his thoughts running through my brain. We need to find a resolution on our own, Captain, as this star doesn't seem too keen on setting right what once went wrong."
